result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa D Olivarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 247 days were granted.
AMENDED 04-14-2015:  Sentence credit of 237 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with victims listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (ie. bars, taverns, or liquor stores.)
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 03/19/15 plea and sentencing.
Dated 04/07/15, from DOC to Judge Carter, requesting review of JOC with regard to days credited.
From defendant's family
filed by the state

Defendant Lisa D Olivarez in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Smith.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing. State makes statements regarding sentencing.  Attorney Smith makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 247 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:victims listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
____No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
